ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a documentary workshop course, which teaches the elements of documentary filmmaking. It also allows students to learn documentary filmmaking through active engagement and process-learning. The weekly classes provide feedback on clips, research, and ideas.I would recommend the class to a student who is already interested in making a documentary film.

If you're a film student, this class is essential. If you're not, but have a fondness for the past, this class is essential. If you're interested in where film language, technology and institutions come from, this class is essential.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It has been truly an amazing journey along the learning curveI loved this courseThe best and most intriguing of my time at Yale

I am very new to film as a discipline, therefore I would have to say I received a lot of the benefits of such a course. It may not be appropriate for someone looking for more of analytical course. This is a course for (future) practitioners.
This course is absolutely essential in film studies. I'll be writing my dissertation on a topic related to my final paper for this class.
